SRO Aimee Lutz of Meadow Glen Middle School posted this on her Facebook page yesterday and her message speaks to the work that Lexington County School District One has done, and will continue to do, as the 2020/2021 school year is soon to begin...

"Just wanted to take a minute to give love to the teachers, office staff, administrators, counselors, custodial staff and food service teams of the schools right now. I'm so glad to be back at the school and seeing the work going into preparing for this year is phenomenal. Picture ants on a mission- they're everywhere, doing hard things in an organized fashion that outwardly appears to be chaotic. Be patient with them and thank them for their months of preparation to make sure our kids have the most productive, loving and safe school year possible."

School Resource Officers will be back to work in their Town of Lexington, SC schools on Monday and we'll introduce you to your child's SRO in the coming days with a profile that will be posted on our social media pages. #LPDStrong #Lex1StrongerTogether #COVID19
